definition: to plan a project/to stand on tiptoe/Taiwan pr. [qi4]/abbr. for 企業|企业[qi3 ye4]
diagram/picture/drawing/chart/map/CL:張|张[zhang1]/to plan/to scheme/to attempt/to pursue/to seek

sentences.english: He never had been able to give form to that ambition.
sentences.chinese: 他從來不能夠具體表現那個企圖心。

sentences.english: Of course, I'm ambitious for you .
sentences.chinese: 當然，我對你們有企圖心。

sentences.english: You have great ambitions for your life, and you are able to work very hard.
sentences.chinese: 你有相當的企圖心，並能夠非常努力的工作。

sentences.english: Our biggest competition in achieving our ambitions is a television set.
sentences.chinese: 我們要展現企圖心時的最大競爭對手就是電視機。

sentences.english: Socrates asks Alcibiades about his personal capacity and the nature of his ambition.
sentences.chinese: 蘇格拉底問阿西比底思的個人能力跟企圖心的特性。

sentences.english: It is in fact one of my ambitions to be imputed a great scorner of the Germans.
sentences.chinese: 事實上，我的企圖心就是要被認爲是德國人的藐視者。

definition: lit. two armies have equivalent banners and drums (idiom); fig. evenly matched/roughly comparable (opponents)
to avoid the important and dwell on the trivial/to keep silent about major charges while admitting minor ones
to have the power to rally supporters
willing (to do sth)/to take pleasure in
to have a unique style of one's own (idiom)
